page.title: 16St.Swithuns Church Crampmoor
page.content: St. Swithuns Church was built in 1859. There were no buildings previously on the site. It is a small but homely church. The vicar is Rev Neil Crawford Jones. He lives at the vicarage near Romsey Abbey. The church services are held on Sundays: 1st Sunday 11.15 Holy Communion; 2nd Sunday 11.15 Family Service; 3rd Sunday 9.00 Holy Communion; 4th Sunday Family Service; 5th Sunday Family Communion. The hall is used for brownies only as it is not big enough for other activities. The maximum capacity of the church is 100. It is used for Baptisms and Funerals but not marriages. Donations to the church include valuable pictures, tapestries, organ and a new altar in memory of Jeffery Finch the previous vicar. The St. Swithuns Club planted a silver birch tree in 1977 for the Queens Silver Jubilee.
